evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.
The tug instructor pulled the aircraft forward off the fence then stopped the tug.

The airport operator and ATC were notified. Soon after, representatives from the airport operator and the RFFS were on scene. The aircraft sustained substantial damage to the rear of the aircraft, including the APU, which was running at the time.
The TRP on Taxiway Delta is between Stands 61L and 61R. There is a 14.97 m clearance behind a B737-800 and the blast fence when its nosewheel is on the TRP.

The tug instructor stated that the method for getting a tug driver to stop quickly was to raise a clenched first, indicating the driver should apply the tug’s brakes. However, he suggested such a visual signal was not sufficient given a driver would be concentrating on the pushback, with the headset operator often out of his field of view. He did not receive any warning of the impending collision from the wingman or the headset operator.

Trainee tug driver The trainee driver was qualified as a headset operator and wingman, and was aware of the TRP through the training for these roles. This was her second pushback. The first was completed earlier that day, without event.

roots_spec.exclusion_clause: Not explained by any other root
Not explained by any other root
Not explained by any other root
Not explained by any other root

slot_statements.availability: Communication/coordination breakdown among crew was observed and documented in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the 12-25 hist_baseline_t2_interim period.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 hist_baseline_t2_interim scenario withstands scrutiny against alternative explanations and contradicting evidence.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with key features identified in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 hist_baseline_t2_interim dataset, including timing, involved personnel, and situational context.

node.statement: Communication/coordination breakdown among crew was observed and documented in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the 12-25 hist_baseline_t2_interim period.

assumptions: Communication breakdown includes ineffective visual signals and lack of warnings from wingman and headset operator
The documented interactions represent the relevant communication context for the incident
defeaters: If evidence showed clear, effective communication and coordination preventing the incident
If hardware or environmental factors were primary causes instead

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so.

He suggested such a visual signal was not sufficient given a driver would be concentrating on the pushback, with the headset operator often out of his field of view. He did not receive any warning of the impending collision from the wingman or the headset operator.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H1-H3 and H8 document communication among crew and highlight a lack of effective warning signals and coordination, supporting the claim of communication/coordination breakdown.
outcome.uncertainty_source: ambiguity in whether procedural deviations or communication failures were primary cause

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with key features identified in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 hist_baseline_t2_interim dataset, including timing, involved personnel, and situational context.

assumptions: The described communication and coordination issues are representative of the key features in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 hist_baseline_t2_interim dataset.
No mechanical faults or environmental deficiencies contributed significantly to the breakdown.
defeaters: If evidence showed effective communication and warnings were given but ignored, or if mechanical faults were present, the conclusion might change.
If environmental or marking deficiencies were proven to be the primary cause, the alignment with communication breakdown would weaken.

The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. Trainee tug driver The trainee driver was qualified as a headset operator and wingman, and was aware of the TRP through the training for these roles. This was her second pushback. The first was completed earlier that day, without event.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H1-H3, H8, and H9 describe the communication setup, personnel roles, and situational context consistent with a coordination breakdown, supporting the claim. The lack of effective warning signals and the trainee's awareness of procedures align with communication failure rather than procedural deviation or mechanical failure.

assumptions: No mechanical fault codes or bench checks are reported in the evidence.
The observed behavior is attributed to operator actions rather than mechanical failure.

quotes.exact_quote: The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H4 and H7 confirm the presence and location of the TRP ground markings in the dataset, and H8 indicates marking visibility and adequacy issues, supporting the environmental or marking deficiency claim. The discriminator disc:R1_PUSHBACK_PROCEDURAL_DEVIATION|R3_ENVIRONMENT_OR_MARKING_DEFICIENCY favors environmental deficiency based on marker adequacy and visibility.
outcome.uncertainty_source: Potential ambiguity in visual signal adequacy and driver attention; no explicit dataset image or direct marking measurement provided

node.statement: The environmental or marking deficiency should align with the key features and characteristics defined for the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 hist_baseline_t2_interim context.

The visual signaling method relates to marking adequacy and environmental deficiency
defeaters: If evidence showed the TRP markings were incorrect or inconsistent with Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA specifications

quotes.exact_quote: The TRP on Taxiway Delta is between Stands 61L and 61R. There is a 14.97 m clearance behind a B737-800 and the blast fence when its nosewheel is on the TRP.

The tug instructor stated that the method for getting a tug driver to stop quickly was to raise a clenched first, indicating the driver should apply the tugs brakes. However, he suggested such a visual signal was not sufficient given a driver would be concentrating on the pushback, with the headset operator often out of his field of view.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H7 confirms the TRP marking and clearance are consistent with Boeing 737-800 dimensions, supporting fit to key features. H8 indicates the visual signaling method was insufficient, suggesting marking adequacy rather than environmental deficiency, favoring the environmental/marking deficiency alignment with key features.
outcome.uncertainty_source: Potential ambiguity in whether signaling method or marking adequacy was primary cause
